bg.x2d.physics

Class Force

  • java.lang.Object
    • bg.x2d.physics.Force
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Friction, GeneralForce, Gravity

    public abstract class Force
extends Object
    Base class for all physics Forces that can be applied to velocity vectors.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

    • Method Detail

      • setForceVector

        public abstract void setForceVector(Vector2f vec)
        Sets the vector for this force. A vector may hold different meanings depending on the force; i.e a force vector might be acceleration, energy, etc. or just straight force in Newtons.
        Parameters:
        vec - the new force direction and magnitude.

      • setForceVector

        public abstract void setForceVector(Vector2d vec)

      • getVec2f

        public abstract Vector2f getVec2f()

      • getVec2d

        public abstract Vector2d getVec2d()

      • getNewtonForce

        public abstract double getNewtonForce(double mass)
        Implementation dependent. Standard implementation for a Newton force will simply return the Force's value regardless of the value of mass. Some forces like Gravity may compute this value using F = ma.
        Parameters:
        mass - mass of object force is being applied to.
        Returns:
        the amount of force exerted on the given object.

      • getAcceleration

        public abstract double getAcceleration(double mass)
        Implementation dependent. Standard implementation for a Newton force will compute this value using F = ma. Gravity, on the other hand, will behave as a field and accelerate all masses the same regardless of mass.
        Parameters:
        mass -
        Returns:
        the acceleration in m/s/s

      • applyTo

        public Vector2f applyTo(float time,
               float mass,
               Vector2f forceSum,
               Vector2f vec)
        Applies this force to the given Vector2f.
        Parameters:
        time - seconds to accelerate the given vector
        mass - of the object in Kg
        forceSum - some Forces may require a sum of other forces also being applied at at the current time interval. This argument is optional, thus all implementations should account for possible null values.
        vec - velocity vector to be accelerated by force.
        Returns:
        the modified Vector2f object (allows for chain calls).

      • applyTo

        public Vector2d applyTo(double time,
               double mass,
               Vector2d forceSum,
               Vector2d vec)
        Applies this force to the given Vector2d.
        Parameters:
        time - seconds to accelerate the given vector
        mass - of the object in Kg
        vec - velocity vector to be accelerated by force.
        forceSum - some Forces may require a sum of other forces also being applied at at the current time interval. This argument is optional, thus all implementations should account for possible null values.
        Returns:
        the modified Vector2f object (allows for chain calls).
